symbols.title: namespace sap.ui.unified

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.Calendar
symbols.description: Basic Calendar. This calendar is used for DatePickers

properties.name: _currentPicker
properties.description:
Holds a reference to the currently shown picker. Possible values: month, monthPicker, yearPicker and yearRangePicker.

Since: 1.84.0.

properties.name: calendarWeekNumbering
properties.description:
If set, the calendar week numbering is used for display. If not set, the calendar week numbering of the global configuration is used. Note: This property should not be used with firstDayOfWeek property.

Since: 1.108.0.

properties.name: firstDayOfWeek
properties.description:
If the property is set, this day marks the start of the displayed week. Valid values are 0 to 6. If no valid property is set, the current locale's default is applied. Note: This property should not be used with the calendarWeekNumbering property.

Since: 1.28.9.

properties.name: initialFocusedDate
properties.description:
Holds a reference to a UI5Date or JavaScript Date object to define the initially navigated date in the calendar.

Since: 1.111.

properties.name: intervalSelection
properties.description:
Determines if an interval of dates can be selected.

Note: This property should be set to false if singleSelection is set to false, as selecting multiple intervals is not supported.

properties.name: maxDate
properties.description:
Maximum date that can be shown and selected in the Calendar. This must be a UI5Date or JavaScript Date object.

Note: if the date is inside of a month the complete month is displayed, but dates outside the valid range can not be selected.

Note: If the maxDate is set to be before the minDate, the minDate is set to the begin of the month of the maxDate.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: minDate
properties.description:
Minimum date that can be shown and selected in the Calendar. This must be a UI5Date or JavaScript Date object.

Note: if the date is inside of a month the complete month is displayed, but dates outside the valid range can not be selected.

Note: If the minDate is set to be after the maxDate, the maxDate is set to the end of the month of the minDate.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: months
properties.description:
Determines the number of months displayed.

As of version 1.50, the duplicated dates are not displayed if there are multiple months.

Note: On phones, only one month is displayed.

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: nonWorkingDays
properties.description:
This property sets chosen days of the week as non-working days, and overrides the weekend days defined in the locale settings. If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days.

    Users could override the non-working days for each week. Valid values inside the array are from 0 to 6. For example:
  • A single day for each week - [3].
  • All days for each week - [0,1,2,3,4,5,6].
  • None of the days for each week - []. In this case all weekdays are working days.

      • Note: Keep in mind that this property sets only weekly-recurring days as non-working. If you need specific dates or dates ranges, such as national holidays, use the specialDates aggregation to set them. Both the non-working days (from property) and dates (from aggregation) are visualized the same.

      Since: 1.28.9.

properties.name: primaryCalendarType
properties.description:
If set, the calendar type is used for display. If not set, the calendar type of the global configuration is used.

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: secondaryCalendarType
properties.description:
If set, the days are also displayed in this calendar type If not set, the dates are only displayed in the primary calendar type

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: showCurrentDateButton
properties.description:
Determines whether there is a shortcut navigation to Today. When used in Month, Year or Year-range picker view, the calendar navigates to Day picker view.

Since: 1.95.

properties.name: showWeekNumbers
properties.description:
Determines whether the week numbers in the months are displayed.

Note: For Islamic calendars, the week numbers are not displayed regardless of what is set to this property.

Since: 1.48.

properties.name: singleSelection
properties.description:
Determines if a single date or single interval, when intervalSelection is set to true, can be selected.

Note: This property should be set to true if intervalSelection is set to true, as selecting multiple intervals is not supported.

properties.name: width
properties.description:
Width of Calendar

Note: There is a theme depending minimum width, so the calendar can not be set smaller.

Since: 1.38.0.

aggregations.name: disabledDates
aggregations.description:
Dates or date ranges for disabled dates.

To set a single date (instead of a range), set only the startDate property of the sap.ui.unified.DateRange class.

Since: 1.38.0.

aggregations.name: header
aggregations.description: Hidden, for internal use only.

aggregations.name: selectedDates
aggregations.description:
Dates or date ranges for selected dates.

To set a single date (instead of a range), set only the startDate property of the sap.ui.unified.DateRange class.

aggregations.name: specialDates
aggregations.description:
Dates or date ranges with type, to visualize special days.

To set a single date (instead of a range), set only the startDate property of the sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange class.

Note: If you need a weekly-reccuring non-working days (weekend), you should use the nonWorkingDays property. Both the non-working days (from property) and dates (from aggregation) are visualized the same.

Note: In case there are multiple sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange instances given for a single date, only the first sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange instance will be used. For example, using the following sample, the 1st of November will be displayed as a working day of type "Type10":

	new DateTypeRange({
		startDate: UI5Date.getInstance(2023, 10, 1),
		type: CalendarDayType.Type10,
	}),
	new DateTypeRange({
		startDate: UI5Date.getInstance(2023, 10, 1),
		type: CalendarDayType.NonWorking
	})

If you want the first of November to be displayed as a non-working day and also as "Type10," the following should be done: 

	new DateTypeRange({
		startDate: UI5Date.getInstance(2023, 10, 1),
		type: CalendarDayType.Type10,
		secondaryType: CalendarDayType.NonWorking
	})

You can use only one of the following types for a given date: sap.ui.unified.CalendarDayType.NonWorking, sap.ui.unified.CalendarDayType.Working or sap.ui.unified.CalendarDayType.None. Assigning more than one of these values in combination for the same date will lead to unpredictable results.

Since: 1.24.0.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description:
Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

Since: 1.28.0.

associations.name: legend
associations.description:
Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the specialDates.

Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.

Since: 1.38.5.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new Calendar.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: startDateChange
events.description:
startDate was changed while navigation in Calendar

Use getStartDate function to determine the current start date

Since: 1.34.0.

events.name: weekNumberSelect

parameters.name: weekNumber
parameters.description: The selected week number.

parameters.name: weekDays
parameters.description: The days of the corresponding week that are selected or deselected.

events.description:
Week number selection changed. By default, clicking on the week number will select the corresponding week. If the week has already been selected, clicking the week number will deselect it.

The default behavior can be prevented using the preventDefault method.

Note Works for Gregorian calendars only and when intervalSelection is set to 'true'.

Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by calling the preventDefault method on the event object.

Since: 1.56.

methods.name: getNonWorkingDays

returnValue.description: Value of property nonWorkingDays

methods.description:
Gets current value of property nonWorkingDays.

This property sets chosen days of the week as non-working days, and overrides the weekend days defined in the locale settings. If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days.

    Users could override the non-working days for each week. Valid values inside the array are from 0 to 6. For example:
  • A single day for each week - [3].
  • All days for each week - [0,1,2,3,4,5,6].
  • None of the days for each week - []. In this case all weekdays are working days.

      • Note: Keep in mind that this property sets only weekly-recurring days as non-working. If you need specific dates or dates ranges, such as national holidays, use the specialDates aggregation to set them. Both the non-working days (from property) and dates (from aggregation) are visualized the same.

returnValue.description: Value of property primaryCalendarType

methods.description:
Gets current value of property primaryCalendarType.

If set, the calendar type is used for display. If not set, the calendar type of the global configuration is used.

methods.description:

methods.description:

Dates or date ranges for selected dates.

Gets current value of property singleSelection.

Determines if a single date or single interval, when intervalSelection is set to true, can be selected.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getStartDate

returnValue.description: date instance for start date

methods.description:
Returns the first day of the displayed month.

There might be some days of the previous month shown, but they can not be focused.

methods.description:

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sCalendarWeekNumbering
parameters.description: New value for property calendarWeekNumbering

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property calendarWeekNumbering.

If set, the calendar week numbering is used for display. If not set, the calendar week numbering of the global configuration is used. Note: This property should not be used with firstDayOfWeek property.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: iFirstDayOfWeek
parameters.description: New value for property firstDayOfWeek

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property firstDayOfWeek.

If the property is set, this day marks the start of the displayed week. Valid values are 0 to 6. If no valid property is set, the current locale's default is applied. Note: This property should not be used with the calendarWeekNumbering property.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is -1.

methods.name: setMonths

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: iMonths
parameters.description: New value for property months

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property months.

Determines the number of months displayed.

As of version 1.50, the duplicated dates are not displayed if there are multiple months.

Note: On phones, only one month is displayed.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is 1.

methods.name: setNonWorkingDays

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sNonWorkingDays
parameters.description: New value for property nonWorkingDays

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property nonWorkingDays.

This property sets chosen days of the week as non-working days, and overrides the weekend days defined in the locale settings. If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days.

    Users could override the non-working days for each week. Valid values inside the array are from 0 to 6. For example:
  • A single day for each week - [3].
  • All days for each week - [0,1,2,3,4,5,6].
  • None of the days for each week - []. In this case all weekdays are working days.

      • Note: Keep in mind that this property sets only weekly-recurring days as non-working. If you need specific dates or dates ranges, such as national holidays, use the specialDates aggregation to set them. Both the non-working days (from property) and dates (from aggregation) are visualized the same.

      When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sPrimaryCalendarType

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property primaryCalendarType.

If set, the calendar type is used for display. If not set, the calendar type of the global configuration is used.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.description:

Determines whether the week numbers in the months are displayed.

Note: For Islamic calendars, the week numbers are not displayed regardless of what is set to this property.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.unified.calendar.Header

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.calendar.Month
symbols.description: renders a month with ItemNavigation This is used inside the calendar. Not for stand alone usage If used inside the calendar the properties and aggregation are directly taken from the parent (To not duplicate and sync DateRanges and so on...)

properties.name: _focusedDate
properties.description:
The value of this property is set trough the sap.ui.unified.Calendar control, in order for the current sap.ui.unified.calendar.Month control to know which is the focused date even if this date is out of the visible date range

Since: 1.90.

properties.name: _renderMonthWeeksOnly
properties.description:
Determines if the control should display only the weeks that fall within the current month or if it should always render a six-week view.

Since: 1.123.

properties.name: calendarWeekNumbering
properties.description:
If set, the calendar week numbering is used for display. If not set, the calendar week numbering of the global configuration is used. Note: This property should not be used with firstDayOfWeek property.

Since: 1.108.0.

properties.name: date
properties.description: A date as UI5Date or JavaScript Date object. The month including this date is rendered and this date is focused initially (if no other focus is set).

properties.name: firstDayOfWeek
properties.description:
If the property is set, this day marks the start of the displayed week. Valid values are 0 to 6. If no valid property is set, the current locale's default is applied. Note: This property should not be used with the calendarWeekNumbering property.

Since: 1.28.9.

properties.name: intervalSelection
properties.description: If set, interval selection is allowed

properties.name: nonWorkingDays
properties.description:
If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 6. If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days.

Since: 1.28.9.

properties.name: primaryCalendarType
properties.description:
If set, the calendar type is used for display. If not set, the calendar type of the global configuration is used.

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: secondaryCalendarType
properties.description:
If set, the days are also displayed in this calendar type If not set, the dates are only displayed in the primary calendar type

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: showHeader
properties.description: If set, a header with the month name is shown

properties.name: showWeekNumbers
properties.description:
Determines whether the week numbers in the months are displayed.

Note: For Islamic calendars, the week numbers are not displayed regardless of what is set to this property.

Since: 1.48.

properties.name: singleSelection
properties.description: If set, only a single date or interval, if intervalSelection is enabled, can be selected

properties.name: width
properties.description:
Width of Month

Since: 1.38.0.

aggregations.name: disabledDates
aggregations.description:
Date Ranges for disabled dates

Since: 1.38.0.

aggregations.name: selectedDates
aggregations.description: Date Ranges for selected dates of the DatePicker

aggregations.name: specialDates
aggregations.description:
Dates or date ranges with type, to visualize special days.

Note: In case there are multiple sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange instances given for a single date, only the first sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange instance will be used. For example, using the following sample, the 1st of November will be displayed as a working day of type "Type10":

	new DateTypeRange({
		startDate: UI5Date.getInstance(2023, 10, 1),
		type: CalendarDayType.Type10,
	}),
	new DateTypeRange({
		startDate: UI5Date.getInstance(2023, 10, 1),
		type: CalendarDayType.NonWorking
	})

If you want the first of November to be displayed as a non-working day and also as "Type10," the following should be done: 

	new DateTypeRange({
		startDate: UI5Date.getInstance(2023, 10, 1),
		type: CalendarDayType.Type10,
		secondaryType: CalendarDayType.NonWorking
	})

You can use only one of the following types for a given date: sap.ui.unified.CalendarDayType.NonWorking, sap.ui.unified.CalendarDayType.Working or sap.ui.unified.CalendarDayType.None. Assigning more than one of these values in combination for the same date will lead to unpredictable results.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

associations.name: legend
associations.description:
Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the specialDates.

Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.

Since: 1.38.5.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new calendar/Month.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: focused date

parameters.name: otherMonth
parameters.description: focused date is in an other month than the displayed one

parameters.name: restoreOldDate
parameters.description: focused date is set to the same as before (date in other month clicked)

events.name: weekNumberSelect

parameters.name: weekNumber
parameters.description: The selected week number.

parameters.name: weekDays
parameters.description:
The days of the corresponding week that are selected or deselected.

Note: Will be set to null if that week is being deselected.

events.description:
Fired when a week number selection is changed. By default, choosing the week number will select the corresponding week. If the week has already been selected, choosing the week number will deselect it.

The default behavior can be prevented using the preventDefault method.

Note: Works for Gregorian calendars only and when intervalSelection is set to true.

Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by calling the preventDefault method on the event object.

Since: 1.60.

		secondaryType: CalendarDayType.NonWorking
	})

You can use only one of the following types for a given date: sap.ui.unified.CalendarDayType.NonWorking, sap.ui.unified.CalendarDayType.Working or sap.ui.unified.CalendarDayType.None. Assigning more than one of these values in combination for the same date will lead to unpredictable results.

properties.name: _firstMonth
properties.description: The first displayed month. The value must be between 0 and 11

properties.name: _focusedMonth
properties.description: The focused month. The value must be between 0 and 11

properties.name: _showSelectedRange
properties.description: When set to true, an interval of months will show as selected even when intervalSelection is set to false. If there is no currently selected date range, the end of the date range will be the currently focused or hovered date.

properties.name: _singleSelection
properties.description:
Determines if a single date or single interval, when intervalSelection is set to true, can be selected.

Note: This property should be set to true if intervalSelection is set to true, as selecting multiple intervals is not supported.

Since: 1.134.0.

properties.name: columns
properties.description:
number of months in each row The value must be between 0 and 12 (0 means just to have all months in one row, independent of the number)

Since: 1.30.0.

properties.name: intervalSelection
properties.description:
Determines if an interval of dates can be selected.

Note: This property should be set to false if _singleSelection is set to false, as selecting multiple intervals is not supported.

Since: 1.74.

properties.name: month
properties.description: The month is initial focused and selected The value must be between 0 and 11

properties.name: months
properties.description:
number of displayed months The value must be between 1 and 12

properties.name: primaryCalendarType
properties.description:
If set, the calendar type is used for display. If not set, the calendar type of the global configuration is used.

Since: 1.34.0.

If set, the months are also displayed in this calendar type If not set, the months are only displayed in the primary calendar type

symbols.title: class sap.ui.unified.calendar.MonthPicker

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.calendar.MonthsRow
symbols.description:
Renders a row of months using ItemNavigation. There is no paging or navigation outside the rendered area implemented. This is done inside the CalendarMonthInterval. If used inside the CalendarMonthInterval the properties and aggregation are directly taken from the parent (to not duplicate and synchronize DateRanges and so on...).

The MontsRow works with UI5Date or JavaScript Date objects, but only the month and the year are used to display and interact. As representation for a month, the 1st of the month will always be returned in the API.

properties.name: date
properties.description: A date as UI5Date or JavaScript Date object. The month including this date is rendered and this date is focused initially (if no other focus is set). If the date property is not in the range startDate + months in the rendering phase, it is set to the startDate. So after setting the startDate the date should be set to be in the visible range.

properties.name: intervalSelection
properties.description: If set, interval selection is allowed

properties.name: months
properties.description: Number of months displayed

properties.name: primaryCalendarType
properties.description:
If set, the calendar type is used for display. If not set, the calendar type of the global configuration is used.

Since: 1.108.0.

properties.name: secondaryCalendarType
properties.description:
If set, the days are also displayed in this calendar type If not set, the dates are only displayed in the primary calendar type

Since: 1.109.0.

properties.name: selectableAccessibilitySemantics
properties.description:
If not set, the grid cells aren't announced as selectable.

Since: 1.139.0.

properties.name: showHeader
properties.description: If set, a header with the years is shown to visualize what month belongs to what year.

properties.name: singleSelection
properties.description:
If set, only a single month or interval, if intervalSelection is enabled, can be selected

Note: Selection of multiple intervals is not supported in the current version.

properties.name: startDate
properties.description: Start date, as UI5Date or JavaScript Date object, of the row. The month of this date is the first month of the displayed row.

aggregations.name: selectedDates
aggregations.description:
Date ranges for selected dates. If singleSelection is set, only the first entry is used.

Note: Even if only one day is selected, the whole corresponding month is selected.

aggregations.name: specialDates
aggregations.description:
Date ranges with type to visualize special months in the row. If one day is assigned to more than one type, only the first one will be used.

Note: Even if only one day is set as a special day, the whole corresponding month is displayed in this way.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

associations.name: legend
associations.description:
Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the specialDates.

Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.

Since: 1.38.5.

parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new MonthsRow. It shows a calendar with month granularity

Note: This is used inside the CalendarMonthInterval, not for standalone usage.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

parameters.description: First date, as UI5Date or JavaScript Date object, of the month that is focused.

parameters.description: If set, the focused date is not rendered yet. (This happens by navigating out of the visible area.)

symbols.title: class sap.ui.unified.calendar.MonthsRow

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.calendar.TimesRow
symbols.description:
Renders a row of time items using ItemNavigation. There is no paging or navigation outside the rendered area implemented. This is done inside the CalendarTimeInterval. If used inside the CalendarTimeInterval the properties and aggregation are directly taken from the parent (to not duplicate and synchronize DateRanges and so on...).

The TimesRow works with UI5Date or JavaScript Date objects.

properties.name: date
properties.description: A date as UI5Date or JavaScript Date object. The month including this date is rendered and this date is focused initially (if no other focus is set). If the date property is not in the range startDate + items in the rendering phase, it is set to the startDate. So after setting the startDate the date should be set to be in the visible range.

properties.name: intervalMinutes
properties.description:
Size of on time interval in minutes, default is 60 minutes.

Note: the start of the interval calculation is always startDat at 00:00.

An interval longer than 720 minutes is not allowed. Please use the DatesRow instead.

A day must be divisible by this interval size. One interval must not include more than one day.

properties.name: intervalSelection
properties.description: If set, interval selection is allowed

properties.name: items
properties.description: Number of time items displayed

properties.name: primaryCalendarType
properties.description:
If set, the calendar type is used for display. If not set, the calendar type of the global configuration is used.

Since: 1.108.0.

properties.name: secondaryCalendarType
properties.description:
If set, the days are also displayed in this calendar type If not set, the dates are only displayed in the primary calendar type

Since: 1.109.0.

properties.name: selectableAccessibilitySemantics
properties.description:
If not set, the grid cells aren't announced as selectable.

Since: 1.139.0.

properties.name: showHeader
properties.description: If set, a header with the years is shown to visualize what month belongs to what year.

properties.name: singleSelection
properties.description:
If set, only a single month or interval, if intervalSelection is enabled, can be selected

Note: Selection of multiple intervals is not supported in the current version.

properties.name: startDate
properties.description: Start date, as UI5Date or JavaScript Date object, of the row.

aggregations.name: selectedDates
aggregations.description: Date ranges for selected dates. If singleSelection is set, only the first entry is used.

aggregations.name: specialDates
aggregations.description: Date ranges with type to visualize special item in the row. If one day is assigned to more than one type, only the first one will be used.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

associations.name: legend
associations.description:
Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the specialDates.

Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.

Since: 1.38.5.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new TimesRow. It shows a calendar with time granularity (normally hours)

Note: This is used inside the CalendarTimeInterval, not for standalone usage.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.calendar.YearPicker
symbols.description: renders a YearPicker with ItemNavigation This is used inside the calendar. Not for stand alone usage. As in all date-time controls, all pubic JS Date objects that are given (e.g. setDate()) or read (e.g. getFirstRenderedDate) with values which are considered as date objects in browser(local) timezone.

properties.name: _middleDate
properties.description:
Date as CalendarDate object. Holds the rendered date in the middle of the grid.

Since: 1.84.0.

properties.name: _showSelectedRange
properties.description: When set to true, an interval of years will show as selected even when intervalSelection is set to false. If there is no currently selected date range, the end of the date range will be the currently focused or hovered date.

properties.name: _singleSelection
properties.description:
Determines if a single date or single interval, when intervalSelection is set to true, can be selected.

Note: This property should be set to true if intervalSelection is set to true, as selecting multiple intervals is not supported.

Since: 1.134.

properties.name: columns
properties.description:
number of years in each row 0 means just to have all years in one row, independent of the number

Since: 1.30.0.

properties.name: date
properties.description:
Date as UI5Date or JavaScript Date object. For this date a YearPicker is rendered. If a Year is selected the date is updated with the start date of the selected year (depending on the calendar type).

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: intervalSelection
properties.description:
Determines if an interval of dates can be selected.

Note: This property should be set to false if _singleSelection is set to false, as selecting multiple intervals is not supported.

Since: 1.74.

properties.name: primaryCalendarType
properties.description:
If set, the calendar type is used for display. If not set, the calendar type of the global configuration is used.

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: secondaryCalendarType
properties.description:
If set, the years are also displayed in this calendar type If not set, the years are only displayed in the primary calendar type

Since: 1.104.0.

properties.name: year
properties.description: The year is initial focused and selected The value must be between 0 and 9999
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.34.0. replaced by date property

properties.name: years
properties.description:
number of displayed years

Since: 1.30.0.

aggregations.name: selectedDates
aggregations.description:
Date Ranges for selected dates of the YearPicker

Since: 1.74.

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.CalendarAppointment
symbols.description:
An appointment for use in a PlanningCalendar or similar. The rendering must be done in the Row collecting the appointments. (Because there are different visualizations possible.)

Applications could inherit from this element to add own fields.

properties.name: color
properties.description:
Overrides the color derived from the type property. This property will work only with full hex color with pound symbol, e.g.: #FF0000.

Since: 1.46.0.

properties.name: description
properties.description:
Description of the appointment.

Since: 1.81.0.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Icon of the Appointment. (e.g. picture of the person)

URI of an image or an icon registered in sap.ui.core.IconPool.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Can be used as identifier of the appointment

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Indicates if the icon is selected.

properties.name: tentative
properties.description: Indicates if the icon is tentative.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Text of the appointment.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title of the appointment.

aggregations.name: customContent
aggregations.description:
Holds the content of the appointment.

Note , If the customContent aggregation is added then:

  • The title, text, description, and icon properties are ignored.
  • The application developer has to ensure, that all the accessibility requirements are met, and that the height of the content conforms with the height provided by the appointment.
  • Do not use interactive controls as content, as they may trigger unwanted selection of the appointment and may lead to unpredictable results.

Note: When using the customContent aggregation, it is the application developer's responsibility to add appropriate labels to the ariaLabelledBy association to provide accessible information about this appointment as the standard properties (title, text, description, and icon) are ignored, which means screen readers will have no information about the appointment unless proper ARIA labeling is implemented.

Since: 1.93.0.

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.CalendarLegend
symbols.description:
A legend for the Calendar Control. Displays special dates colors with their corresponding description. The aggregation specialDates can be set herefor.

Calendar Legend Navigation

If the Calendar Legend is associated with a sap.ui.unified.Calendar control, the users can navigate through the Calendar Legend items. Only special dates related to the navigated legend's item type are displayed in the calendar grid. Note: Standard calendar legend items (Today, Selected, Working Day and Non-Working Day) are also navigatable, but focusing them does not affect the special dates display (all calendar special dates are displayed).

Keyboard shortcuts (when the legend is navigatable)

  • [Arrow Up], [Arrow Left] - Move to the previous calendar legend item
  • [Arrow Down], [Arrow Right] - Move to the next calendar legend item
  • [Home], [Page Up] - Move to the first calendar legend item
  • [End], [Page Down] - Move to the last calendar legend item

Since: 1.54.

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.CalendarMonthInterval
symbols.description:
Calendar with granularity of months displayed in one line.

Note: UI5Date or JavaScript Date objects are used to set and return the months, mark them as selected or as a special type. But the date part of the Date object is not used. If a Date object is returned the date will be set to the 1st of the corresponding month.

properties.name: _currentPicker
properties.description:
Holds a reference to the currently shown picker. Possible values: monthsRow and yearPicker.

Since: 1.84.0.

properties.name: intervalSelection
properties.description: If set, interval selection is allowed

properties.name: maxDate
properties.description:
Maximum date that can be shown and selected in the Calendar. This must be a UI5Date or JavaScript Date object.

Note: If the maxDate is set to be before the minDate, the minDate is set to the begin of the month of the maxDate.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: minDate
properties.description:
Minimum date that can be shown and selected in the Calendar. This must be a UI5Date or JavaScript Date object.

Note: If the minDate is set to be after the maxDate, the maxDate is set to the end of the month of the minDate.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: months
properties.description:
Number of months displayed

Note: On phones, the maximum number of months displayed in the row is always 6.

properties.name: pickerPopup
properties.description:
If set, the yearPicker opens on a popup

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: singleSelection
properties.description:
If set, only a single date or interval, if intervalSelection is enabled, can be selected

Note: Selection of multiple intervals is not supported in the current version.

properties.name: startDate
properties.description: Start date of the Interval as UI5Date or JavaScript Date object. The month of this Date will be the first month in the displayed row.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the CalendarMonthInterval. The width of the single months depends on this width.

aggregations.name: header
aggregations.description: Hidden, for internal use only.

aggregations.name: selectedDates
aggregations.description:
Date ranges for selected dates of the CalendarMonthInterval.

If singleSelection is set, only the first entry is used.

Note: Even if only one day is selected, the whole corresponding month is selected.

aggregations.name: specialDates
aggregations.description:
Date ranges with type to visualize special months in the CalendarMonthInterval. If one day is assigned to more than one type, only the first one will be used.

Note: Even if only one day is set as a special day, the whole corresponding month is displayed in this way.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

associations.name: legend
associations.description:
Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the specialDates.

Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.

Since: 1.38.5.

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.CalendarRow
symbols.description: A calendar row with a header and appointments. The Appointments will be placed in the defined interval.

properties.name: appointmentHeight
properties.description:
Defines the height of the CalendarAppoinment

Since: 1.81.0.

properties.name: appointmentRoundWidth
properties.description:
Defines rounding of the width of CalendarAppoinment Note: This property is applied, when the calendar interval type is Day and the view shows more than 20 days

Since: 1.81.0.

properties.name: appointmentsReducedHeight
properties.description:
If set the appointments without text (only title) are rendered with a smaller height.

Note: On phone devices this property is ignored, appointments are always rendered in full height to allow touching.

Since: 1.38.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.81. Please use the appointmentHeight with value "Automatic" property instead.

properties.name: appointmentsVisualization
properties.description:
Defines the visualization of the CalendarAppoinment

Note: The real visualization depends on the used theme.

Since: 1.40.0.

properties.name: checkResize
properties.description:
If set, the CalendarRow checks for resize by itself.

If a lot of CalendarRow controls are used in one container control (like PlanningCalendar). the resize checks should be done only by this container control. Then the container control should call handleResize of the CalendarRow if a resize happens.

properties.name: groupAppointmentsMode
properties.description:
Defines the mode in which the overlapping appointments are displayed.

Note: This property takes effect, only if the intervalType of the current calendar view is set to sap.ui.unified.CalendarIntervalType.Month. On phone devices this property is ignored, and the default value is applied.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the row

properties.name: intervalSize
properties.description: Number of interval type units merged. It's used when presenting Relative View in sap.m.PlanningCalendar. Note: If the value is more than 1, the NonWorkingDays type is not presented.

properties.name: intervalType
properties.description: Type of the intervals of the row. The default is one hour.

properties.name: intervals
properties.description: Number of displayed intervals. The size of the intervals is defined with intervalType

properties.name: multipleAppointmentsSelection
properties.description:
Determines whether the selection of multiple appointments is enabled.

Note: selection of multiple appointments is possible using CTRL key regardless of the value of this property.

Since: 1.97.

properties.name: nonWorkingDays
properties.description:
If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 6. (Other values will just be ignored.)

If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days.

Note: The non working days are only visualized if intervalType is set to day.

properties.name: nonWorkingHours
properties.description:
If set, the provided hours are displayed as non-working hours. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 23. (Other values will just be ignored.)

Note: The non working hours are only visualized if intervalType is set to hour.

properties.name: showEmptyIntervalHeaders
properties.description:
If set, interval headers are shown even if no intervalHeaders are assigned to the visible time frame.

If not set, no interval headers are shown if no intervalHeaders are assigned.

Note: This property is only used if showIntervalHeaders is set to true.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: showIntervalHeaders
properties.description:
If set, interval headers are shown like specified in showEmptyIntervalHeaders.

If not set, no interval headers are shown even if intervalHeaders are assigned.

properties.name: showSubIntervals
properties.description:
If set, subintervals are shown.

If the interval type is Hour, quarter hours are shown.

If the interval type is Day, hours are shown.

If the interval type is Month, days are shown.

properties.name: startDate
properties.description: Start date, as UI5Date or JavaScript Date object, of the row. As default, the current date is used.

properties.name: updateCurrentTime
properties.description:
If set the CalendarRow triggers a periodic update to visualize the current time.

If a lot of CalendarRow controls are used in one container control (like PlanningCalendar) the periodic update should be triggered only by this container control. Then the container control should call updateCurrentTimeVisualization of the CalendarRow to update the visualization.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the row

aggregations.name: appointments
aggregations.description:
Appointments to be displayed in the row. Appointments outside the visible time frame are not rendered.

Note: For performance reasons, only appointments in the visible time range or nearby should be assigned.

aggregations.name: intervalHeaders
aggregations.description:
Appointments to be displayed in the top of the intervals. The intervalHeaders are used to visualize public holidays and similar things.

Appointments outside the visible time frame are not rendered.

The intervalHeaders always fill whole intervals. If they are shorter than one interval, they are not displayed.

Note: For performance reasons, only appointments in the visible time range or nearby should be assigned.

aggregations.name: nonWorkingPeriods
aggregations.description:
Sets the provided period to be displayed as a non-working.

Since: 1.128.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description:
Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

Note These labels are also assigned to the appointments.

associations.name: legend
associations.description:
Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the Appointments.

Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.

Since: 1.40.0.

Gets current value of property showSubIntervals.

If set, subintervals are shown.

If the interval type is Hour, quarter hours are shown.

If the interval type is Day, hours are shown.

If the interval type is Month, days are shown.

Default value is false.

returnValue.description: Value of property startDate

Start date, as UI5Date or JavaScript Date object, of the row. As default, the current date is used.

methods.name: getUpdateCurrentTime

returnValue.description: Value of property updateCurrentTime

methods.description:
Gets current value of property updateCurrentTime.

If set the CalendarRow triggers a periodic update to visualize the current time.

If a lot of CalendarRow controls are used in one container control (like PlanningCalendar) the periodic update should be triggered only by this container control. Then the container control should call updateCurrentTimeVisualization of the CalendarRow to update the visualization.

Default value is true.

returnValue.description: Value of property width

methods.description:

Width of the row

methods.name: handleResize

returnValue.description: Reference to this for method chaining

parameters.name: oEvent
parameters.description: The event object of the resize handler.

methods.description:
After a resize of the CalendarRow, some calculations for appointment sizes are needed.

For this, each CalendarRow can trigger the resize check for it's own DOM. But if multiple CalendarRows are used in one container (e.g. PlanningCalendar), it is better if the container triggers the resize check once and then calls this function of each CalendarRow.

If a lot of CalendarRow controls are used in one container control (like PlanningCalendar). the resize checks should be done only by this container control. Then the container control should call handleResize of the CalendarRow if a resize happens.

Defines the mode in which the overlapping appointments are displayed.

Note: This property takes effect, only if the intervalType of the current calendar view is set to sap.ui.unified.CalendarIntervalType.Month. On phone devices this property is ignored, and the default value is applied.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is Collapsed.

Note: selection of multiple appointments is possible using CTRL key regardless of the value of this property.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setNonWorkingDays

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sNonWorkingDays
parameters.description: New value for property nonWorkingDays

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property nonWorkingDays.

If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 6. (Other values will just be ignored.)

If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days.

Note: The non working days are only visualized if intervalType is set to day.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setNonWorkingHours

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sNonWorkingHours
parameters.description: New value for property nonWorkingHours

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property nonWorkingHours.

If set, the provided hours are displayed as non-working hours. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 23. (Other values will just be ignored.)

Note: The non working hours are only visualized if intervalType is set to hour.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setShowEmptyIntervalHeaders

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowEmptyIntervalHeaders
parameters.description: New value for property showEmptyIntervalHeaders

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property showEmptyIntervalHeaders.

If set, interval headers are shown even if no intervalHeaders are assigned to the visible time frame.

If not set, no interval headers are shown if no intervalHeaders are assigned.

Note: This property is only used if showIntervalHeaders is set to true.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

If not set, no interval headers are shown even if intervalHeaders are assigned.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: updateCurrentTimeVisualization

returnValue.description: Reference to this for method chaining

methods.description:
If the current time is in the visible output of the CalendarRow, the indicator for the current time must be positioned.

For this, each CalendarRow can trigger a timer. But if multiple CalendarRows are used in one container (e.G. PlanningCalendar), it is better if the container triggers the interval once and then calls this function of each CalendarRow.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.unified.CalendarRow

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.CalendarTimeInterval
symbols.description: Calendar with granularity of time items displayed in one line.

properties.name: _currentPicker
properties.description:
Holds a reference to the currently shown picker. Possible values: timesRow, datesRow, monthPicker and yearPicker.

Since: 1.84.0.

properties.name: intervalMinutes
properties.description:
Size of on time interval in minutes, default is 60 minutes.

Note: the start of the interval calculation is always on the corresponding date at 00:00.

An interval longer than 720 minutes is not allowed. Please use the CalendarDateInterval instead.

A day must be divisible by this interval size. One interval must not include more than one day.

properties.name: intervalSelection
properties.description: If set, interval selection is allowed

properties.name: items
properties.description:
Number of time items displayed. Default is 12.

Note: On phones, the maximum number of items displayed in the row is always 6.

properties.name: maxDate
properties.description:
Maximum date that can be shown and selected in the Calendar. This must be a UI5Date or JavaScript Date object.

Note: If the maxDate is set to be before the minDate, the minDate is set to the begin of the month of the maxDate.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: minDate
properties.description:
Minimum date that can be shown and selected in the Calendar. This must be a UI5Date or JavaScript Date object.

Note: If the minDate is set to be after the maxDate, the maxDate is set to the end of the month of the minDate.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: pickerPopup
properties.description:
If set, the day-, month- and yearPicker opens on a popup

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: singleSelection
properties.description:
If set, only a single date or interval, if intervalSelection is enabled, can be selected

Note: Selection of multiple intervals is not supported in the current version.

properties.name: startDate
properties.description: Start date of the Interval as UI5Date or JavaScript Date object. The time interval corresponding to this Date and items and intervalMinutes will be the first time in the displayed row.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the CalendarTimeInterval. The width of the single months depends on this width.

aggregations.name: header
aggregations.description: Hidden, for internal use only.

aggregations.name: selectedDates
aggregations.description:
Date ranges for selected items of the CalendarTimeInterval.

If singleSelection is set, only the first entry is used.

aggregations.name: specialDates
aggregations.description: Date ranges with type to visualize special items in the CalendarTimeInterval. If one interval is assigned to more than one type, only the first one will be used.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

associations.name: legend
associations.description:
Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the specialDates.

Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.

Since: 1.38.5.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: iIntervalMinutes
parameters.description: New value for property intervalMinutes

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property intervalMinutes.

Size of on time interval in minutes, default is 60 minutes.

Note: the start of the interval calculation is always on the corresponding date at 00:00.

An interval longer than 720 minutes is not allowed. Please use the CalendarDateInterval instead.

A day must be divisible by this interval size. One interval must not include more than one day.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is 60.

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.ColorPicker
symbols.description:
Enables the user to select a color. The color can be defined using HEX, RGB, or HSV values or a CSS color name.

Note: Keep in mind that this control needs either sap.m or sap.ui.commons library to be loaded in order to work as it depends on controls available in one or the other library.

properties.name: colorString
properties.description:
Determines the input parameter that can be a string of type HEX, RGB, HSV, or a CSS color name:

  • HEX - #FFFFFF
  • RGB - rgb(255,255,255)
  • HSV - hsv(360,100,100)
  • CSS - red
Note: The output parameter is an RGB string of the current color.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: displayMode
properties.description:
Determines the display mode of the ColorPicker among three types - Default, Large and Simplified

Since: 1.58.

properties.name: mode
properties.description:
Determines the color representation mode the ColorPicker works with - Hue, Saturation, and Value (HSV) or Hue, Saturation, and Lightness (HSL).

Note: The ColorPickerMode.HSV is set by default. For color composing with alpha values, please set the mode to ColorPickerMode.HSL

Since: 1.48.0.

aggregations.name: _grid
aggregations.description:
Holds the control layout.

Since: 1.48.0.

aggregations.name: _invisibleTexts
aggregations.description:
Holds the control invisible texts.

Since: 1.48.0.

parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.ContentSwitcherAnimation
symbols.description:
Predefined animations for the ContentSwitcher

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/unified/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'ContentSwitcherAnimation'.

experimental.text: API is not yet finished and might change completely

properties.name: sap.ui.unified.ContentSwitcherAnimation.Fade
properties.description: Content is faded (opacity change).

properties.name: sap.ui.unified.ContentSwitcherAnimation.None
properties.description: No animation. Content is switched instantly.

properties.name: sap.ui.unified.ContentSwitcherAnimation.Rotate
properties.description: The new content rotates in. (Just like one of those old newspaper-animations.)

properties.name: sap.ui.unified.ContentSwitcherAnimation.SlideOver
properties.description: The new content slides in from the left while the old content slides out to the left at the same time.

properties.name: sap.ui.unified.ContentSwitcherAnimation.SlideRight
properties.description: The new slides in from the left (to the right).

properties.name: sap.ui.unified.ContentSwitcherAnimation.ZoomIn
properties.description: The new content is "zoomed in" from the center and grows to fill the full content area.

properties.name: sap.ui.unified.ContentSwitcherAnimation.ZoomOut
properties.description: The old content is "zoomed out", i.e. shrinks to a point at the center of the content area.

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.Currency
symbols.description:
A text view which displays currency values and aligns them at the decimal point.

Overview

The currency control consists of an amount, which is formatted automatically according to the users locale (using delimiter symbols for the decimal point and thousand separators) and to the currency set for this specific number (number of decimal places).

The currency is expressed as a three-letter code.

Usage

When to use

  • To display amounts with different currencies in a vertical layout, such as in a table, list, or form, and it is important that the user is able to compare the amounts.

When not to use

  • To display amounts with the same currency in a table. Use the sap.m.ObjectNumber instead.
  • to display a number with a unit of measurement that is not a currency. Use the sap.m.ObjectNumber instead.
  • To display an amount in a structure other than a list, table, or form.

Responsive behavior

The control supports amounts smaller than 100 trillion, which still fit on a phone screen in portrait mode. For larger amounts, the unit of measurement wraps to the next line, which makes it difficult to compare the amounts.

properties.name: currency
properties.description:
Determines the displayed currency code (ISO 4217).

Note: If a * character is set instead of currency code, only the character itself will be rendered, ignoring the value property.

properties.name: emptyIndicatorMode
properties.description:
Specifies if an empty indicator should be displayed when there is no text.

Since: 1.89.

properties.name: maxPrecision
properties.description: Defines the space that is available for the precision of the various currencies.

properties.name: stringValue
properties.description:
Determines the currency value as a string.

String value is useful if you want to store really big values. If there are more than 21 digits before the decimal point or if the number starts with 0. followed by more than five zeros, it is represented in exponential form. In these cases use the stringValue property to keep the number in decimal format.

Note: If set, it will take precedence over the value property.

Since: 1.54.

properties.name: useSymbol
properties.description: Displays the currency symbol instead of the ISO currency code.

properties.description: Determines the currency value.

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.FileUploader
symbols.description: The framework generates an input field and a button with text "Browse ...". The API supports features such as on change uploads (the upload starts immediately after a file has been selected), file uploads with explicit calls, adjustable control sizes, text display after uploads, or tooltips containing complete file paths.

properties.name: additionalData
properties.description:
Additional data that is sent to the back end service.

Data will be transmitted as value of a hidden input where the name is derived from the name property with suffix "-data".

properties.name: buttonOnly
properties.description: If set to "true", the FileUploader will be rendered as Button only, without showing the input field.

properties.name: buttonText
properties.description: The button's text can be overwritten using this property.

properties.name: directory
properties.description:
Allows users to upload all files from a given directory and its corresponding subdirectories.

Since: 1.105.0.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Disabled controls have different colors, depending on customer settings.

properties.name: fileType
properties.description:
The chosen files will be checked against an array of file types.

If at least one file does not fit the file type restriction, the upload is prevented. Note: This property is not supported by Microsoft Edge.

Example: ["jpg", "png", "bmp"].

properties.name: httpRequestMethod
properties.description:
Chosen HTTP request method for file upload.

Since: 1.81.0.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button.

This can be a URI to an image or an icon font URI.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: iconFirst
properties.description:
If set to true (default), the display sequence is 1. icon 2. control text.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: iconHovered
properties.description:
Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is hovered (only if also a base icon was specified).

If not specified, the base icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: iconOnly
properties.description:
If set to true, the button is displayed without any text.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: iconSelected
properties.description:
Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is selected (only if also a base icon was specified).

If not specified, the base or hovered icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: maximumFileSize
properties.description:
A file size limit in megabytes which prevents the upload if at least one file exceeds it.

This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

properties.name: maximumFilenameLength
properties.description:
The maximum length of a filename which the FileUploader will accept.

If the maximum filename length is exceeded, the corresponding event filenameLengthExceed is fired.

Since: 1.24.0.

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description:
The chosen files will be checked against an array of MIME types defined in this property.

If at least one file does not fit the MIME type restriction, the upload is prevented.

Note: This property is not supported by Internet Explorer. It is only reliable for common file types like images, audio, video, plain text and HTML documents. File types that are not recognized by the browser result in file.type to be returned as an empty string. In this case the verification could not be performed. The file upload is not prevented and the validation based on file type is left to the receiving backend side.

Example: ["image/png", "image/jpeg"].

properties.name: multiple
properties.description:
Allows multiple files to be chosen and uploaded from the same folder.

This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

Note: Keep in mind that the various operating systems for mobile devices can react differently to the property so that fewer upload functions may be available in some cases.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Unique control name for identification on the server side after sending data to the server.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Placeholder for the text field.

properties.name: sameFilenameAllowed
properties.description:
If the FileUploader is configured to upload the file directly after the file is selected, it is not allowed to upload a file with the same name again. If a user should be allowed to upload a file with the same name again this parameter has to be "true".

A typical use case would be if the files have different paths.

properties.name: sendXHR
properties.description:
If set to "true", the request will be sent as XHR request instead of a form submit.

This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

properties.name: style
properties.description:
Style of the button.

Values "Transparent, "Accept", "Reject", or "Emphasized" are allowed.

properties.name: uploadOnChange
properties.description: If set to "true", the upload immediately starts after file selection. With the default setting, the upload needs to be explicitly triggered.

properties.name: uploadUrl
properties.description: Used when URL address is on a remote server.

properties.name: useMultipart
properties.description:
If set to "false", the request will be sent as file only request instead of a multipart/form-data request.

Only one file could be uploaded using this type of request. Required for sending such a request is to set the property sendXHR to "true". This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Value of the path for file upload.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description:
Visualizes warnings or errors related to the text field.

Possible values: Warning, Error, Success, None.

Since: 1.24.0.

properties.name: valueStateText
properties.description:
Custom text for the value state message pop-up.

Note: If not specified, a default text, based on the value state type, will be used instead.

Since: 1.52.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Specifies the displayed control width.

aggregations.name: headerParameters
aggregations.description: The header parameters for the FileUploader which are only submitted with XHR requests. Header parameters are not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

aggregations.name: parameters
aggregations.description:
The parameters for the FileUploader which are rendered as a hidden input field.

Since: 1.12.2.

aggregations.name: xhrSettings
aggregations.description:
Settings for the XMLHttpRequest object. Note: This aggregation is only used when the sendXHR property is set to true.

Since: 1.52.

associations.name: ariaDescribedBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new FileUploader.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: change

parameters.name: newValue
parameters.description: New file path value.

parameters.name: files
parameters.description: Files.

events.description:
Event is fired when the value of the file path has been changed.

Note: Keep in mind that because of the HTML input element of type file, the event is also fired in Chrome browser when the Cancel button of the uploads window is pressed.

events.name: fileAllowed
events.description: Event is fired when the file is allowed for upload on client side.

events.name: fileEmpty

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of the file to be uploaded.

events.description: Event is fired when the size of the file is 0

events.name: filenameLengthExceed

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The filename, which is longer than specified by the value of the property maximumFilenameLength.

events.description:
Event is fired, if the filename of a chosen file is longer than the value specified with the maximumFilenameLength property.

Since: 1.24.0.

events.name: fileSizeExceed

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of a file to be uploaded.

parameters.name: fileSize
parameters.description: The size in MB of a file to be uploaded.

events.description: Event is fired when the size of a file is above the maximumFileSize property. This event is not supported by Internet Explorer 9 (same restriction as for the property maximumFileSize).

events.name: typeMissmatch

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of a file to be uploaded.

parameters.name: fileType
parameters.description: The file ending of a file to be uploaded.

parameters.name: mimeType
parameters.description: The MIME type of a file to be uploaded.

events.description: Event is fired when the type of a file does not match the mimeType or fileType property.

events.name: uploadAborted

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of a file to be uploaded.

parameters.name: requestHeaders
parameters.description:
Http-Request-Headers.

Required for receiving requestHeader is to set the property sendXHR to true. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

events.description:
Event is fired after the current upload has been aborted.

This event is only supported with property sendXHR set to true, i.e. the event is not supported in Internet Explorer 9.

Since: 1.24.0.

events.name: uploadComplete

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of a file to be uploaded.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description:
Response message which comes from the server.

On the server side this response has to be put within the "body" tags of the response document of the iFrame. It can consist of a return code and an optional message. This does not work in cross-domain scenarios.

parameters.name: readyStateXHR
parameters.description:
ReadyState of the XHR request.

Required for receiving a readyStateXHR is to set the property sendXHR to true. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Status of the XHR request.

Required for receiving a status is to set the property sendXHR to true. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

parameters.name: responseRaw
parameters.description:
Http-Response which comes from the server.

Required for receiving responseRaw is to set the property sendXHR to true.

This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description:
Http-Response-Headers which come from the server.

Provided as a JSON-map, i.e. each header-field is reflected by a property in the headers object, with the property value reflecting the header-field's content.

Required for receiving headers is to set the property sendXHR to true. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

parameters.name: requestHeaders
parameters.description:
Http-Request-Headers.

Required for receiving requestHeaders is to set the property sendXHR to true. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

events.description:
Event is fired as soon as the upload request is completed (either successful or unsuccessful).

To see if the upload request was successful, check the status parameter for a value 2xx. The actual progress of the upload can be monitored by listening to the uploadProgress event. However, this covers only the client side of the upload process and does not give any success status from the server.

events.name: uploadProgress

parameters.name: lengthComputable
parameters.description: Indicates whether or not the relative upload progress can be calculated out of loaded and total.

parameters.name: loaded
parameters.description: The number of bytes of the file which have been uploaded by the time the event was fired.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description: The total size of the file to be uploaded in bytes.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of a file to be uploaded.

parameters.name: requestHeaders
parameters.description:
Http-Request-Headers.

Required for receiving requestHeaders is to set the property sendXHR to true. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

events.description:
Event is fired after the upload has started and before the upload is completed.

It contains progress information related to the running upload. Depending on file size, band width and used browser the event is fired once or multiple times.

This event is only supported with property sendXHR set to true, i.e. the event is not supported in Internet Explorer 9.

Since: 1.24.0.

events.name: uploadStart

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of a file to be uploaded.

parameters.name: requestHeaders
parameters.description:
Http-Request-Headers.

Required for receiving requestHeaders is to set the property sendXHR to true. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

events.description:
Event is fired before an upload is started.

Since: 1.30.0.

methods.name: abort

parameters.name: sHeaderParameterName
parameters.description:
The name of the parameter within the headerParameters aggregation to be checked.

Note: aborts the request, sent with a header parameter with the provided name. The parameter is taken into account if the sHeaderParameterValue parameter is provided too.

parameters.name: sHeaderParameterValue
parameters.description:
The value of the parameter within the headerParameters aggregation to be checked.

Note: aborts the request, sent with a header parameter with the provided value. The parameter is taken into account if the sHeaderParameterName parameter is provided too.

methods.description: Aborts the currently running upload.

Http-Response-Headers which come from the server.

Provided as a JSON-map, i.e. each header-field is reflected by a property in the headers object, with the property value reflecting the header-field's content.

Required for receiving headers is to set the property sendXHR to true. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

parameters.name: requestHeaders
parameters.description:
Http-Request-Headers.

Required for receiving requestHeaders is to set the property sendXHR to true. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

methods.description: Fires event uploadComplete to attached listeners.

parameters.name: mParameters
parameters.description: Parameters to pass along with the event

parameters.name: lengthComputable
parameters.description: Indicates whether or not the relative upload progress can be calculated out of loaded and total.

parameters.name: loaded
parameters.description: The number of bytes of the file which have been uploaded by the time the event was fired.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description: The total size of the file to be uploaded in bytes.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of a file to be uploaded.

parameters.name: requestHeaders
parameters.description:
Http-Request-Headers.

Required for receiving requestHeaders is to set the property sendXHR to true. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.
